kpis.kpi: total equity to total assets ratio
kpis.description: This ratio measures the proportion of a company's total assets that are financed by shareholders' equity. A higher ratio indicates a stronger solvency position, as it suggests that a larger portion of the company's assets are funded by equity rather than debt.

kpis.kpi: total debt to total equity ratio
kpis.description: This ratio indicates the relative proportion of a company's total debt to its shareholders' equity. A higher ratio suggests that a company is more leveraged, which may indicate higher financial risk.

This ratio measures a company's ability to cover its interest expenses with its operating income. A higher ratio indicates better solvency, as it suggests that the company generates sufficient income to meet its interest obligations.

kpis.kpi: retained earnings to total assets ratio
kpis.description: This ratio indicates the proportion of a company's total assets that are financed by retained earnings. A higher ratio suggests a stronger solvency position, as it indicates that a larger portion of the company's assets are funded by profits that have been reinvested in the business.

kpis.kpi: market capitalization to book value of equity ratio
kpis.description: This ratio compares a company's market capitalization to its book value of equity. A ratio greater than 1 indicates that the market values the company higher than its book value, which may suggest positive investor sentiment and perceived growth potential.
kpis.formula: Market Capitalization / Book Value of Equity
